title: Is buying a refurbished mobile phone good or should I go for a new one? - Quora

response.answer_text: Deciding to Buy a Refurbished Cell Phone The decision to actually buy a refurbished cell phone has several parts, including the issue of whether buying any cell phone is really necessary. Other considerations include price, risk, and what kind of cell phone is actually wanted. Sometimes the right cell phone will be a refurbished phone; other times it will not be. Reasons to Buy a Refurbished Phone The most obvious reason to buy a refurbished phone is price. A refurbished phone is less expensive than a similar new phone, everything else being equal. Everything else is not always equal, and it is sometimes possible to find a deeply discounted new phone that is a better deal than a refurbished phone would be. Buying a refurbished phone is also a good way to stick with a favorite model a bit longer, even after the company has moved on to a new design. There are people who really like having the newest, flashiest gadget, but there are other people who really prefer to stick with what works for them. Finally, buying refurbished phones is one way to help reduce waste. Though many electronics companies now recycle their used products, reusing an item as many times as possible before recycling saves a lot of energy. Precautions Necessary With a Refurbished Phone The most serious risk with buying a refurbished phone is that it might not actually have been refurbished. Phones also sometimes come with histories, such as an unpaid balance from the previous owner. Finally, many people buy refurbished phones as an affordable way to replace a cell phone that has been lost or stolen. The concept of Refurbished smartphones is not a new thing in western markets, but it wasn’t until recently that this term was well-known in India. Refurbished phones are not new phones. These phones have been used by consumers before, though they might not be used for a very long time.Refurbished phones have been used before and yes, there might be some minor scratches on the body, but They are not second hand phones.  When consumers return a faulty handset with a minor defect, it is repaired and sold as refurbished handset. phones are tested by the company and most of the time they come with same warranty. Advantages of buying Refurbished PhonesGood Price – The best part of refurbished phones is that they cost less than a new phone, but deliver the same experience. you can end up with a great deal if you know what you are looking for. Environment friendly – By buying refurbished phone, you help reducing electronic waste So if you take environment seriously, that is one more reason to buy a refurbished phone. Doubly tested – These handsets have been tested by company, by users and then again by skilled technicians so they go through more rigorous testing than new phones. PrecautionsRefurbished phones, like new smartphones may be defective and hence, return policy and warranty are very important. Also check efficiency of customer care department of the retailer you are buying from. Check phone accessories, ports and Battery Make sure that all inbox accessories are functional. Check IMEI number If you are buying from a lesser known retailer, make sure you check the IMEI number, which is usually available under battery or can be accessed by dialing *#06#. You should use IMEI number and contact manufacturer who can fill you in regarding the history of the phone and let you know if the phone was ever stolen, Don’t buy dated phones, Check Software  The phone should not have any suspicious third party app pre-installed on it which you cannot identify. Also make sure that the pone is properly reset to factory condition and is free from any content from previous owner.
